column4: any idea why the uid/gid on my nfs mount is showing 4294967294
your user on both systems host/server need to have the same UID/GID
i am using ldap for authentcation
thats seperate and regardless
how do i ensure that they are the same?
check you UID on both
this might look like a silly question i did id in both machines and b oth of them are 1000
UID and GID are same on both?
i ran id <username>
does it have something to do with the /etc/idmapd.conf file?
dont know. I use NFS and never had to mess with that file.
any pointers?
your on Linux on both ends right? Not using Unix services for windows, right?
nope both from the same vm template
sorry got d/c
ok, but both vm's are linux right?
yes sir both ubuntu

Ok, you got me. You dont need ldap just for nfs, I use nfs here at work and dont use ldap, so Im not sure if ldap is configured properly or not of if it wold cause your problem, but as long as your UID/GIDs match on both sides you should be ok.
what was the issue before you used ldap
no issue with ldap it works fine, i can change passwords, do id all sorts of thigns and it works fine
http://serverfault.com/questions/98741/files-mounted-over-nfsv4-are-owned-by-4294967294-uids-and-gids-match
thanks for pointer, NEED_IDMAPD is what i had to change as well
it was the use idmapd thingy
great
